properties.areaDesc: Southern Centre; Blair; Clearfield; Northern Centre; Cambria; Mifflin; Huntingdon
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 8 at 10:58AM EST by NWS State College PA
properties.description:
HAZARDS...A snow squall which can rapidly reduce visibility to less
than a quarter of a mile.

LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1058 AM EST, a snow squall was along a
line extending from Port Matilda to near Prince Gallitzin State Park
and moving southeast at 30 MPH.

THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR...
Stormstown and Port Matilda around 1105 AM EST.
Ramblewood, Rock Springs and Tipton around 1115 AM EST.
Pine Grove Mills around 1120 AM EST.
Whipple Dam State Park and Sinking Valley around 1125 AM EST.
Mcalevys Fort and Canoe Creek State Park around 1130 AM EST.
Williamsburg around 1135 AM EST.

This includes Interstate 99 from mile markers 35 to 64.

SAFETY INFO...
Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall.
Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to
lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until this squall passes
your location.

Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roadway and then
quickly refreezes.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CENTRE...CLEARFIELD... BLAIR...CAMBRIA...HUNTINGDON...MIFFLIN...AND SOUTHERN CENTRE COUNTIES
